blackmail-INSTRUCTIONS

Setup the Exercise:

  1. Download the Blackmail_Project folder.
  2. Place the  folder on your desktop
  3. Rename the folder to be: Lastname_Blackmail
    • Leave the html, images, and css
    • do not change any of the names
    • do not change the folder relationships
  4. Open the Blackmail_Project.html in Dreamweaver. File>Open...
  5. Change the <title> of the document to be your Last, Firstname
  6. File>Save... LEAVE the document named...Blackmail_Project.html
  7. The style.css is created and linked externally
  8. The content is provided:
    • the text content
    • oreo forground image
    • #wrapper
    • And "Kranky" Font is activated from a Google resource.
    • I added a tracing image to help
  9. You will add necessary html structure. (You can cange the tags)
  10. You will add selectors using class and/or ids. (choose your own)
  11. You will control the layout by adding necessary styles. (from scratch)

Production:

  1. Change the #wrapper background color to white.
  2. Change the #wrapper alpha to a comfortable amount for you to work.
  3. Visualize boxes around content to begin the formatting.
  4. Determine how to best use the existing elements
  5. Assign new #id or .class selector names to any of the html structure.
  6. Apply CSS to style the new selectors you assign
  7. Add ugly colors
  8. You may also add new structure, for example...
    <div> or <span> or headline tags if preferred.
  9. Choose fonts you feel appropriate to render the design
    • Use only system-based fonts (ones in your computer).
    • Use a font-stack for fall-back safety.
  10. Set margins and padding as needed.
  11. Prove control of the design by making it match, as close as possible, my original poem layout.
When almost finished...
  1. Remove the ugly background colors from boxes
  2. Remove the tracing image by deleting lines 3-7 in the CSS. 
  3. Add a new body selector to the css
  4. Adding appropriate bg color and/or texture to the new body selector
  5. Change the #wrapper background-color: rgba(255, 255, 255, .5); to use a 1.0 for the alpha setting; obscuring the background texture.
  6. Package the Lastname_Blackmail folder into a zip file.
  7. Submit the Lastname_Blackmail.zip in Blackboard

Done
